title: How to Play the Ice Breaker Game People Bingo
text:
How to Play the Ice Breaker Game People Bingo Always the Most Popular Ice Breaker Party Game for Adults! Martin Barraud / Getty Images By Deb Peterson Updated February 07, 2017 . 
People Bingo is one of the most popular ice breaker games for adults in the classroom because it's so easy to customize for your particular group and situation, and almost everyone knows how to play it. We'll explain how to play, and show you how to make your own People Bingo game cards. Plus, we've got lists of ideas to get you started. Ideal Size 
Up to 30. Divide larger groups. Use For 
Introductions in the classroom or at a meeting . Perfect for groups that have a specific purpose for meeting because you can easily make your own cards with relevant characteristics on them. This game also makes an excellent energizer. Time Needed 
30 minutes, depending on the size of the group. Materials Needed 
Bingo cards. See instructions below. Instructions 
If you know your participants, make a list of 25 interesting traits that describe different aspects of them, things like, “plays the bongos,” “once lived in Sweden,” “has a karate trophy,” “has twins,” “collects children’s art,” “has a tattoo.” 
If you don’t know your participants, make a list of more general traits like “drinks tea instead of coffee”, “loves the color orange,” “has two cats,” “drives a hybrid,” “went on a cruise in the last year.” You can make these easy or difficult depending on how much time you want the game to take. 
It's very easy to make your own bingo cards using regular printer paper, especially if you're on a tight budget or don't have much time to prepare. Check out these easy step-by step instructions: How to Make a People Bingo Card . 
Remember to leave room for signatures.
